[MY PREVIOUS ACTION - Turn 145]
Reasoning: **Balatro Ante 7 Big Blind Decision: Skip for the Meteor Tag**

Okay, here's the situation: Ante 7, Big Blind is up, and I'm at a crossroads. Current ante is at 7, with a Big Blind of 52,500 chips needed. I have the Meteor Tag available (Mega Celestial Pack), which seems like an enticing option. The upcoming Boss blind is a hefty 140,000 chips. Right now, I have zero dollars in my pocket.

My inventory is decent: I've got the Ancient Joker (Spades x1.5), two Hanging Chads, a Smeared Joker (suits merge), and a Stuntman (chip boost), alongside an 8 Ball (negative card, potentially Tarot generation). I also have Strength and "The World" consumables (3 Spades). My hand levels are Flush (Lvl 3), Full House (Lvl 6), and 3 of a Kind (Lvl 4). My last Flush score was around 140k.

Ancient Joker is a bit of a question mark. It *should* have changed suits after the last small blind (Turn 144) ended, but I won't know the suit until I enter the round. Smeared Joker is great for building Flushes. The Hanging Chads will give me the first card triggering 5 times. That's big value. Stuntman is a nice flat chip boost.

Playing the Big Blind has its benefits: $4 + interest (currently $0, so only $4) and a shop afterwards. Plus, it gives me a chance to use the 8 Ball. My potential score is over the required 52.5k, so winning is easy.

Skipping the round for the Meteor Tag gets me a Mega Celestial Pack. This could really boost Flush and Full House levels. The downside is missing out on the shop, money, and 8 Ball.

The goal is to beat Ante 8. I am very capable of beating it with 140k scores. The current boss is 140k. If I skip, I get a free $10 Mega Celestial Pack. Should I skip?

Initially, playing seemed appealing for the potential shop access and some cash. But then I realized I already have six jokers, and a lack of money. The Ancient Joker suit is also a variable. Based on my current score potential, skipping for levels to make the boss safer seems like the better move.

I *could* potentially use my Tarots in the 8 Ball, but I'm at $0. I need some money, as I would need to sell to buy anything from the shop. If I skip, I go directly to the Boss blind and then the shop. If I play the Big Blind, I go to a shop *before* the Boss. Given my economy, is the immediate power-up from the pack worth more than a shop I can't afford? Considering that I just opened a Mega Celestial Pack, I am considering the immediate value of an additional Mega Celestial Pack.

If I skip, then Meteor Tag, the Boss, the shop. Skipping and receiving the Meteor Tag will offer an immediate power boost (two free Planets). I get to level up before the Boss.

Checking the Boss blind, it will require 140,000 chips.

If I play the Big Blind, I'll win and get some cash. If I skip, I get a Mega Celestial Pack. I am comfortable that my previous score of 140,856 exceeds this requirement. # Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
play_round - Play the current round.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
